709514f-a.text:
Burns' Restaurant, 783-785 Sixth Avenue, west side, between 44th and 45th Streets, with ell running through to 45th Street. This property was sold at auction shortly after this photograph was made.
March 3, 1914.

713188f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 111) a point slightly west of Sixth Ave. to Broadway, showing prominently the Belasco Theatre; bearing No. 111-121. Adjacent to same on the west is the 13-story Hotel Langwell (No. 123-129) which was formerly known as the Hotel Gerard.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.

713188f-b.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 111) a point slightly west of Sixth Ave. to Broadway, showing prominently the Belasco Theatre; bearing No. 111-121. Adjacent to same on the west is the 13-story Hotel Langwell (No. 123-129) which was formerly known as the Hotel Gerard.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
September 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.

709511f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from W. 44th Street (where buildings begin), viewing towards Rockefeller Center and its dominant R. C. A. Building. At the right is the parking lot that utilizses the former Hippodrome site (43rd to 44th St's.). Across a corner of same appears the 2-story taxpayer and its adjoining office structure, the Rafel Building, No. 67 W. 44th Street. View 3 is limited to the taxpayer.
May 6, 1939
Views 1,2 negative #2665,3
P. 1. Sperr

709511f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, north from W. 44th Street (where buildings begin), viewing towards Rockefeller Center and its dominant R. C. A. Building. 709496f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at the S. E. corner of 44th Street (left) showing a portion of the Hippodrome. This structure occupies the full Avenue frontage from 43rd to 44th Streets, and is at this date under demolition. The debris in the foreground is caused by subway workers employed on the new Sixth Avenue Subway.

Sept. 20, 1939

Mr. Nathan Schwartz
Mew York Public Library
Negitive (?) A-1362

713190f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue, showing prominently the Hotel Algonquin (No. 59-65 W. 44th St.) as photographed across the site of the former Hippodrome. Adjacent to same on the right is the 8 story City Club (No. 55 W. 44th St.). At the left and right margins respectively are the Rafel Bldg. (No. 67) and the Hotel Iroquois (No. 49). The photographers vantage point is 43rd Street east of the
Avenue, and he is viewing northeastward.
May 5, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

713190f-b.text:
West 44th Street, north side, east of Sixth Avenue, showing prominently the Hotel Algonquin (No. 59-65 W. 44th St.) as photographed across the site of the former Hippodrome. Adjacent to same on the right is the 8 story City Club (No. 55 W. 44th St.). At the left and right margins respectively are the Rafel Bldg. (No. 67) and the Hotel Iroquois (No. 49). The photographers vantage point is 43rd Street east of the
Avenue, and he is viewing northeastward.
May 5, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

713189f-a.text:
West 44th Street, north side, west from (No. 129), but not including Sixth Ave. Shown in the foreground, at Nos. 139-41, is the Columbia Radio Playhouse, formerly the Hudson Theatre.
August 9, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

709510f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., west side, north from but not including West 44th Street, showing the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line (right) and construction work on the Sixth Ave. subway, which will eventually replace the elevated structure. In the background appears the 70-story R.C.A. Building, at Rockefeller
Center, from West 49th to West 50th Streets.
August 24, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

709512f.text:
Sixth Avenue at N. W. corner of 44th Street.
About 1885.

709513f-a.text:
(1)
Sixth Avenue, West Side from about 44th Street looking Northwards. Hotel Ariosto is shown at the North West corner.
April 5th,1939
(2)
The same,with a closer view of Hotel Ariosto.
January 29th,1928
P.L.Sperr,Photographs
